page.title: 09Communication in Fenton area
page.content: There is a local magazine called Trentside Links, which was first produced in November 1984 by a voluntary committee. The original idea for a magazine came from the Kettlethorpe Parish Council, who saw a definite need for communication between the surrounding villages of Kettlethorpe, Fenton, Laughterton, Marton, Torksey and Newton. The magazine consists of eight pages, a diary of events, schools page, quiz page, church news, local business adverts and a feature page. At present it is produced bi-monthly and printed by the Aveland Youth Training Workshop in Grantham. A mobile library calls at Fenton fortnightly and local residents can be supplied with any type of book they wish. Certain books may be ordered. The service is provided by Lincolnshire County Council.
